text: being an anime fan in america in the
early 2000s was rough not only because
getting access to the shows you wanted
wasn't always easy but also because you
were bullied at school if it wasn't
dubbed you could be relying on fan
translations but if you were making fan
translations you had to worry about
miami mike and what he did at dragoncon
often when anime was dubbed officially
by a studio that had a license it wasn't
always the best translation or even a
direct translation and one show that was
at the center of dubbing controversy was
sailor moon
but today we're talking about card
captors
card captors is an anime series that
originally aired on kids wb from 2001
2002. it's a story about a young girl
named sakura avalon as she accidentally
unleashes the power of the magical clown
cards onto the world the clown cards are
based on tarot cards but don't follow
the same naming convention instead
they're all named after a mystical power
and all have a physical manifestation
that can be caught or captured sakura is
guided by kiro a once mighty warrior who
helps her realize her potential as a
card captor as she lives her life as a
middle schooler card captors is an
adaptation of card captor sakura the
anime based on the manga card captor
sakura holy sh and while kids wb tried
to market the show as a boys action show
similar to many of the shonen anime that
were becoming popular in the west at the
time cardcaptors is categorically not
that in fact most of the focus of the
show is sakura's school life and
romantic interest in an older boy
however kidswb certainly tried to make
it seem like something it wasn't
changing episode airing orders
downplaying the romance to overselling
the show's action in its marketing card
captors is a different show but it's a
show that many people grew up with this
video will only be focusing on card
captors and while i may revisit the
series and look at some other aspects of
the franchise at some point right now i
really only want to focus on the english
adaptation i remember watching card
captors growing up i remember certain
episodes pretty vividly and i remember
looking through the actual physical
cloud cards but i don't really remember
whose they were but i wouldn't say i was
a huge fan of card captors not because i
didn't like the series but because i
didn't make sure to watch it every time
it was on so let's take a look back on
cardcaptors and refresh my memory a
little bit but first today's video is

much more of the focus is put on the

sakura in this version is a feisty
preteen who initially lacks
self-confidence she's guided by kiro a
once powerful guardian warrior created
by the magician clow reed and meant to
protect the clow cards now if you look
closely kiro is actually a ditto real
kiro looks like this at first sakura
doubts her ability to catch the cards
but as the show continues she gains the
confidence she should have and even
holds her own against people who've
trained their whole lives in the magical
arts sakura lives with her older brother
tori and her dad
sakura's dad a professor in archaeology
at a local university which is how the
clow card book ended up in sakura's
house sakura's mom died when she was
very young satori and sakura often have
to take on a more active role within
their family in order to help out their
dad sakura's dad is very sweet but super
busy so isn't always around and tori is
kind of a jerk but it's only in an
outward capacity he's always there to
help sakura out we'll defend her if he
has to and will even do nice gestures
for her just because he wants to here
take it it's yours
thank you tori
tori's best friend is julian an older
boy who sakura may or may not have a

the original version the english
adaptation changes a lot of dialogue to
make it less obvious but the scenarios
the characters are put in still points
in the direction of a crush now i may
have missed a line here or there but i
definitely think the romantic subplot is
subdued in the english version because
this isn't a romantic show it's an
action show for boys wakiro is sakura's
sassy guide sakura's best friend is
madison madison is one of the few that
learn of sakura's identity as a card
captor but she's also like super rich
and super creative so she makes sakura a
new outfit for every single card they
have to capture and she films scenes of
sakura capturing cards to put on her
website but you know it's still a secret
that sakura is a card captor actually
you know what trying to get seen online
is really difficult so i believe
that it can still be a secret the
dynamic between kiro sakura and madison
is great i also love the idea that
madison makes sakura's outfits to make

it's a fun way to justify the sometimes

that youtube hustle madison managed to

overall stylish yet practical look would
it tell
is just the best wanna know how much i
like kiro
after a few episodes in we're introduced
to lee a descendant of claw reed who
thinks that he should be the one to
recapture the cards instead of sakura
lee is a great addition to the show he's
super cocky and confident out in the
field but socially he's really timid shy
and awkward next we're introduced to
melee a friend of liz who's aware of the
clown reed tradition but has no magical
powers of herself mae is very jealous of
sakura especially because she has
magical abilities which is something she
has in common with lee
hey
that clown card should have gone to lee
you know she tries to help out capturing
cards but more often than not she ends
up getting in the way while the episodes
themselves sometimes have similar plot
beats the show is definitely not
formulaic often a cloud card won't
reveal itself until the end of an
episode and in other circumstances the
clow card may be causing trouble behind
the scenes of an episode but won't be
directly faced until the end to say
cardcaptors is an action show would be
misleading while there is action
happening sometimes it's more
adventurous action than violent action
there's rarely fights that happen
between cards and the cast of the
characters but that's just because of
the nature of the card abilities i mean
how do you fight a maze
they try usually card captures play out
a bit like a mystery the first step is
just discovering which of the cards is
making odd things happen then it's just
a matter of getting close enough to it
for sakura to use her clow key to
recapture it once a card is captured the
owner can use the card's powers in order
to help them catch other cards and
eventually sakura learns how to use the
power of two cards at once god forbid
she figures out how to use five i think
one of my favorites is the time card
sakura and lee discover they're in a
time loop and have to figure out what's
causing it to stop it i also like the
shot card episode because it's this odd
gun allegory and it's just like someone
has a gun but they don't know it's a gun
and then i love the dash card episode
because it's just this super cute little
animal who just wants to help some dorky
girl win her track meet it's great but
then there are episodes where a card
isn't captured like when sakura and her
family go and visit sakura's grandfather
who's been lonely ever since the passing
of sakura's mother sakura uses her cards
to make a rainbow to remind him of her
mother it's just a really nice and sweet
episode card captors is a pretty fun
slice of life show that just so happens
to have all that magical girl stuff
sprinkled on top and it's really
enjoyable keep in mind me saying it it's
enjoyable is not to direct praise or
condemnation to the english adaptation
but rather it's most likely to say that
the good aspects of the show shine
through the english adaptation
despite all of the changes made so now

i like these characters they all have a

characters can be compared to
compartmentalize
compartmental
compartmentalize compartmentalized
compartmentalized
oh my god organized as different parts
of sakura's life they overlap and
interact with each other in really fun
ways like when madison has to find
excuses for sakura when she's out
capturing cards lee being jealous of
julian and seeing him as a rival for
sakura's affection and sakura and melee
having a rivalry that only melee
recognizes the cloud card plot is really
just icing on the cake and that's a good
thing however cardcaptors is not a good
translation whatsoever there are many
huge and giant and massive and
gargantuan and enormous and big and
large changes made that are just
baffling and while if you're unaware of
these changes the show still works there
are definitely issues i had without
having seen the original show so it
turns out kids wb decided not to air the
show in order if you want to know just
how insanely hacked up the airing order
was just browse the episode list on
wikipedia it's pretty crazy cardcaptors
only adapted about 39 of the 70 total
episodes ending airing right as the
show's second arc was starting which is
a shame because that's when i started to
feel really invested in the story they
even skipped over several early episodes
right at the beginning just so they
could introduce lee sooner into the
story and while i'm not sure if they're
present in the original versions
sometimes they have to flash back to a
card capture to explain where sakura got
a certain ability because the original
episode was just skipped over romance is
involving significant age differences
are downplayed like sakura's crush on
julian and the fact that sakura's dad
was her mom's teacher when they started
dating which is very uncomfy light and
heavy references to characters being gay
were also removed including madison
potentially having a crush on sakura and
towards the end of the series julian
reveals to sakura that he's in love with
tori and implies they're even in a
relationship with one another i mean i
know it was the early 2000s and times
were different but i wish the english
adaptation got to the episode where
julian revealed this the sakura so we
could get the ultimate twist that tori
and julian are actually just cousins the
show was heavily marketed to appeal to
boys from the theme song change to
heavily using lee in the marketing
despite not appearing in every episode
sakura's voice was changed to be more
grown up it's basically getting as close
to ash ketchum as possible and these
changes were made to appeal to kids wb's
demographic which was largely young boys
but fans of the original series were
livid with these changes and rightfully
so i mean now cardcaptor sakura can be
seen easily so the changes cardcaptors
made while odd are less serious now but
in 2001 when this was the only way to
see the series without bootlegging or
dealing with miami mike at dragoncon it
must have been infinitely frustrating
now before cardcaptors there were many
english adaptations that poorly
translated the source material but card
captors came out during the age of the
internet a time where people could air
their grievances in other places besides
just a fan magazine that only big
dorks would read the demand for
a more accurate version got so intense
that pioneer entertainment the publisher
who had the license to sakura in the
west released a complete dvd volume set
of uncut card captors with original
japanese audio and english subtitles
which were best sellers for the company
while this is commonplace now an
official release of this kind at the
time was incredibly rare cardcaptors to
me is important in anime history because
it seems to have signaled to western
distributors that people really do want
to see the original versions of these
shows and that releasing a subtitled
release is a simple yet viable solution
and although we didn't get an accurate
dub of card captor sakura until about
at least
we got kiro
